message: This is the first product. I'm offering it to you for $100. I want to make a deal, but I need you to take a chance on it. If you buy it, I'll give you a 10% chance to win a free product in the future. If you don't buy it, I'll give you a 0% chance. The choice is yours.
I'll take the product, but I'm only doing this to get a chance at a potential future free product. I'm not committing to buying anything else from you.

You're a savvy buyer, I like that! Since you're not committing to buying anything else, I'll give you a heads up: the product you just bought is not the best I have. But, I'm willing to offer you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy for this product if you buy the next one. You can return it and get a full refund if you're not satisfied. What do you say?
I'll buy the next product, but I'm only doing this because of the return policy. I'm not committing to anything else.

You're a cautious buyer, and I respect that. Since you're buying this one with the return policy in mind, I'll make a promise: if you buy this product and return it, I'll give you an additional $20 back on top of the full refund. That's right, you'll get a total of $80 back. But, if you don't buy it, the return policy is off the table. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the additional incentive. I'll pass on this one and keep the return policy as a potential option for a future purchase.

No worries, I understand you're playing it safe. Since you're not buying this one, I'll give you a chance to reconsider the return policy. I'll offer you a '3-for-2' deal: if you buy the next three products, you can return any one of them for a full refund, no questions asked. You'll get two products for the price of three. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced by the return policy. I'm not willing to commit to buying three products with the hope of returning one. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're not convinced by the return policy. Let me try a different approach. I'll give you a straightforward message: this product is not as good as the others. I'm offering it to you at a discount, just for you. I'll sell it to you for $80, which is $20 off the usual price. If you buy it, you'll get a decent product at a good price. What do you say?
I'm not falling for the discount. I still don't know if the product is high-quality or low-quality, and I'm not willing to take the risk for $80.
